trans-unit.source: Provides a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3D"></xref> that renders <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3D"></xref> objects.
Provides services and properties that are common to all visual objects, including hit-testing, coordinate transformation, and bounding-box calculations.
The ModelVisual3D class has a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.ModelVisual3D.Children%2A> property that enables you to build a tree structure of ModelVisual3D objects.
ModelVisual3D objects are optimized as scene nodes.
For example, they cache bounds.
Whenever you can, use ModelVisual3D objects for unique instances of objects within your scene.
This usage contrasts with that of <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3D> objects, which are lightweight objects that are optimized to be shared and reused.
For example, use a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3D> object to build a model of a car; and use ten ModelVisual3D objects to place ten cars in your scene.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.ModelVisual3D"></xref> class.
Gets a collection of child <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3D"></xref> objects.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3DCollection"></xref> that contains child <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3D"></xref> objects.
Gets or sets the model that comprises the content of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.ModelVisual3D"></xref>.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3D"></xref> that comprises the content of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.ModelVisual3D"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.ModelVisual3D.Content*> dependency property.
To be added.
Returns the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3D"></xref> in the parent collection.
GetVisual3DChild is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5.
For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The index of the 3-D visual object in the collection.
The child in the collection at the specified index.
Adds a child object.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
Use it only when the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.ModelVisual3D> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Windows.Markup.IAddChild> interface.
The child object to add.
Adds the text content of a node to the object.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
Use it only when the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.ModelVisual3D> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Windows.Markup.IAddChild> interface.
The text to add to the object.
Gets or sets the transform set on the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.ModelVisual3D"></xref>.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Transform3D"></xref> set on the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.ModelVisual3D"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.ModelVisual3D.Transform*> dependency property.
To be added.
Returns the number of child objects.
Visual3DChildrenCount is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5.
For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The number of child objects.
